----- Original Message -----
From: Ken Lee <kenlee@...>
To: <eq_wizards@onelist.com>
Sent: Thursday, April 22, 1999 11:28 AM
Subject: [eq_wizards] Re: Digest Number 18


> From: "Ken Lee" <kenlee@...>
>
> That's another annoying problem. I was running with a monk that became
> pk (I'll use pk and nonpk because it's less confusing to me) and the
cleric
> in the party wouldn't help him at all. He even said, don't heal me, don't
> buff me or you'll become pk. Very cool of him.

Yeah, that was good of him. I think there is a warning message if you try
to buff, but still.

>
> As to the looting issue, that's absurd. (In your favor) NO ONE should
be
> able to loot your body unless they personally killed you. Another point
for
> you, and that's something that I think they need to address. I didn't know
> that just anyone could pick stuff off your body. As a matter of fact, I'd
> make looting a pk body that you didn't kill turn you pk. That'd be more
> reasonable I think. Believe me, no one's picking on you, maybe taking the
> easy way out, but not singling out pk players.

Oops, since I play on zek, where everyone is PK I didn't clarify. nPK
players can't loot fallen pk. But since on zek everyone is PK the fact that
npk can't loot you is irrelwevant. there aren't any npk to loot or not loot
you.
>
> As to coding the changes. It's more than likely that it's easier to make
> them not be able to cast anything on you instead of being selective. As a
> matter of fact I KNOW it'd be easier that way. It's like having 1 switch
to
> turn on all the lights in your house, or running around and turning some
on
> and some off.

Yes, easier to code in the first place. But, what I am saying is that the
code for selectively choosing what spells work is ALREADY there. You are
npk. You cast heal on someone. it works. you cast ice strike on someone.
it doesn't work. See, the code is already in there, they just aren't
applying the rules to PK for some reason.

>
> All in all though, I think that for the moment, it'd be better to just
enjoy
> the game as is for the moment, and work towards what changes you'd like.
> There's a fdback button there, use it and have all the pk players you know
> use it as well. Good to hear the comments though.

Yep, they are probably getting sick of feedback from me by now. I am really
enjoying the game, and I think the game is fundamentally great, but bugs
that have been known about for this long that have such a potentially HUGE
gameplay effect should be gone by now. Nice talking to you.

>
> Zalbar
> 14th Wizard
> Solusek Ro
>
>
>

will

obvious
> >if you have played the game at all. -PvP has no real problems (I play
> >a -PvP ranger on the Rathe). +PvP still has a couple HUGE, game balance
> >destroying issues that would be pretty simple to fix. From what I read
> >about the testing on the test server, it looks like they may finally have
> >addressed the issue as the looting for +PvP is supposed to have changed.
> To
> >give you a brief rundown of the current problem, you are a lvl 35 (insert
> >any class here) player. You accidentally have autoattack on or are
playing
> >song of discord or aoe a critter that is standing near a guard at one of
> the
> >kelethin lifts. The guard kills you. ANY person who comes along can
loot
> >you. Even lvl 1 newbies. Goodbye black robe and no way to get it back
> from
> >them (four level limit). Obviously this screws up game balance a bit.
All
> >they need to do to fix it is apply the same loot ruels they use for MOBs.
> >If you didn't kill it, you don't get to loot it.
> >
> >However, non combat spells you should be able to cast on
> >> others. Bind Affinity, O'Keils radiation, Invisibility, great spells,
and
> >> I'm behind you 110% in that you should be able to use them on others.
I'm
> >> sure they'll change it in the future, but how long depends on how hard
it
> >is
> >> to code.
> >
> >I wouldn't think it would be that hard as most players can already cast
> them
> >on others, just not +PvP for some reason. +PvP spells would work exactly
> >as -PvP spells on a -PvP person. There is no difference whatsoever in
how
> >they should behave. if a -PvP can cast it on a -PvP, a +PvP should be
able
> >to. The code is all there, and all works, except they aren't using it.
> The
> >only sane explanation is they are punishing +PvP for something. BTW, if
> you
> >are +PvP you can forget about -PvP helping you ever. They can't cast
> >helpful spells on you without becoming +PvP themselves. Of course, I
play
> >on zek, where the only real concern is the looting issue I just
mentioned.
